document_info.title: Veggie Oil Extraction Log - amor_fati's Compendium Research
document_info.thread_url: dmt-nexus.me/forum - Veggie Oil Extraction Log Options
document_info.author_credentials: DMT-Nexus Chemical Expert, Senior Member, 2291 posts
document_info.purpose: Development of food-safe, grocery-store-only extraction methodology using vegetable oil as primary solvent
related_projects: Compendium for the Extraction of Jurema
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical extraction chemistry research.

core_concept.principle: Using heated vegetable oil as a nonpolar solvent to extract alkaloids, replacing toxic solvents like naphtha
goals: Obtain reasonably pure extract comparable to heptane using only heated veggie oil
Extract to exhaustion for maximum yield
Obtain less pure but active extract by adding small amount of limonene to used oil
Pure extract for vaporization, mixed extract for Juremala (oral preparation)
core_concept.key_discovery: Dual-solvent mixture of limonene and veggie-oil extends viability of insufficient amounts of limonene, reducing extraction costs substantially

threads_referenced.title: The Poor Mans Tek
threads_referenced.description: 100% Fat Free, Food Safe, Grocery Store Solution to DMT Extraction

threads_referenced.title: amor_fati's Nontoxic Approach to the Extraction of DMT
No d-Limo, No NP Solvent, No Acetone, All-Natural Extraction?
threads_referenced.description: Exploration of fully natural extraction methods

pure_veggie_oil_extraction.appearance: Quite pale in color, fairly fluffy
pure_veggie_oil_extraction.notes: Yield smaller due to lighter filtering than normal and stirring in THP

pure_limonene_extraction.workability: Tends to jump around when scraped up - troublesome
pure_limonene_extraction.remedy: Add bit of water, scrape into pile, re-evaporate

veggie_oil_freebase_conversion.result: Points to veggie-oil pulling MORE PURE product than limonene or mixture
veggie_oil_freebase_conversion.issue_noted: Contamination possible if sodium carbonate not thoroughly washed off

limonene_veggie_oil_mixture.appearance: Far easier to scrape up than pure limonene
limonene_veggie_oil_mixture.advantage: Best of both worlds - easier handling

oil_traces.issue: FASW evap likely to leave traces of oil behind
solutions: Light IPA wash followed by quick thorough drying
oil_traces.interesting_note: Product doesn't seem quite soluble in veggie-oil, opening interesting possibilities

recommended_oils.primary: Soy oil (often sold as generic vegetable oil)
recommended_oils.advice: Try different oils - the cheaper the better
recommended_oils.warning: NOT recommended with water-intensive teks (typically using NaOH) - reports fairly negative

salting_methods.vinegar: Be wary, though more reports needed
salting_methods.plastic_safety: Limonene diluted with veggie oil seems less prone to dissolving plastics

vinegar_salting_confirmed.tested_with: Veggie oil with limonene added (less than 3:1 ratio)
vinegar_salting_confirmed.technique: Freeze mixture to separate polar and nonpolar layers, decant nonpolar - emulsions never a bother
vinegar_salting_confirmed.vinegar_preparation: Distilled white vinegar diluted with water (~1:5) - reduces acetic acid contamination

methods_successful: Double boiler style dish over steambath (crockpot for steam)
heat_induced_dissociation.technique: Repeated manual crystallization to expose more acetates and release acetic acid
heat_induced_dissociation.potential_improvement: Quick rinse with saturated sodium carbonate solution followed by cold water rinse

february_22_update.grocery_store_goal: Everything necessary can be obtained at grocery store - no specialty materials like fumaric acid needed

observations: Soy oil turns out quite yellow, not orangish
Soy seems more peanut buttery oily than olive oil
Olive oil result more powdery and less oily
Olive oil looks more like limo extracted but lighter color, bit pink
After iso pulls from freebased fumarates, dries to clear dense oil
Dries white color, then orangish pink when scraped up
logos2012_olive_oil_notes.concern: Most soy in stores is GMO - organic available online

curiouskid_sunflower_experiment.issue: Freezer caused everything to be frozen-liquefied
curiouskid_sunflower_experiment.solution_provided: Shake and squeeze out like shampoo, leaving solid FASW chunk in bottom

big_inhale_stb_issue.problem: Gray and sparkly top layer instead of olive oil color - emulsion
big_inhale_stb_issue.advice: Wet teks may be troublesome with oils. Freezing may help. Use lime instead of lye for better results.

technical_tips.stirring_method: Keep material in jar for stirring, decant through THP, only dump directly into THP on final pull
technical_tips.yield_factors: Yield in limtek depends mainly on quality of basification (adequate lime, water, and stirring)
technical_tips.solvent_retention: Basified mixture may hold onto some oil - keep performing flushes, with THP it will all drain
technical_tips.emulsion_handling: Freeze to separate - emulsions never a bother with this technique

wiki_resource.title: Amor_fati's Compendium for the Extraction of Jurema
wiki_resource.status: In development at time of thread

key_terminology.FASW: Freeze And Separate Water - technique to separate polar and nonpolar layers by freezing
key_terminology.limtek: Limonene-based extraction technique using calcium hydroxide (lime)
key_terminology.MHRB: Mimosa Hostilis Root Bark - common DMT-containing plant material
key_terminology.Juremala: Oral DMT preparation (like ayahuasca but using Jurema/Mimosa)

safety_and_food_grade.advantage: All materials obtainable at grocery store
safety_and_food_grade.solvents: Food-safe vegetable oils replace toxic petroleum solvents
safety_and_food_grade.caution: Be wary of plastic compatibility even with diluted limonene
safety_and_food_grade.storage: Use HDPE, glass, or metal containers

curiouskid_sunflower_full_report.method: Q21Q21 style with 25g MHRB using straight sunflower oil
curiouskid_sunflower_full_report.pulls: About four pulls, each salted 4 times
curiouskid_sunflower_full_report.smell: Smelled like spice when burned, also smelled like french fries
curiouskid_sunflower_full_report.problem: 25mg in GVG - nothing! Only subtle effect. 30mg in bong - same!
process_used: Acidification with vinegar + near boiling water
NP wash with sunflower oil (heated on electric heater for better fluidity)
Evaporation in glass dish on electric heater overnight

amor_fati_shoddy_experiment.material: 200+g shredded MHRB (not pre-powdered, blender burnt out)
amor_fati_shoddy_experiment.base_mixture: Quarter cup lime + just over half sodium carbonate + bit of bicarbonate = ~1 cup total
amor_fati_shoddy_experiment.reason: Ran low on lime, decided to experiment

extraction: Acid bath on shredded bark as-is
Distributed base mixture evenly between two halves
Submerged in minimal soybean oil to cover shreds
Decanting tricky - shredded bark and sodium carb/bicarb don't absorb water well
salting: Dilute vinegar (at least 1:5 distilled white to tap water)
Vigorous shaking, no more than 5 minutes
Oil froze to gel-like slush, polar layer froze solid
Shook to break up oil slush, squeezed out like shampoo
Added tiny bit limonene and dash 90% IPA, shook, poured off
crystallization: Evaporated vinegar/acetate solution at 68C for a day
Left oil droplets and acetate resin
IPA wash to remove oil droplets
Partial manual crystallization scraping and smearing
Back to dehydrator, repeated process several times

key_observations: After IPA wash, simultaneous odor of acetic acid and freebase detected
Each scrape/smear cycle: acetic smell subsided, freebase smell became more prevalent
Gooey mixture solidified more and more as process repeated

result.appearance: Super hard, dark resin ball - seemed sketchy but quite pungent
result.further_processing: Dropwise saturated sodium carbonate solution, flattening with spatula
result.manual_crystallization: Could only achieve soft, slightly sticky ball with odd coloration
result.bioassay: 36mg loaded into Inspirator mkII - definite breakthrough, slightly weaker than expected

conclusions: Lack of adequate lime contributed to impurities
IPA wash between dehydrator sessions may have helped
Sodium carbonate solution freebase conversion may have been unnecessary
Wide threshold for error - still achieved smokable product despite worst efforts

chacruna_discussion.question: How to do veggie oil extraction with Chacruna?
chacruna_discussion.concern: N-oxide form - most DMT in Chacruna reportedly in N-oxide form

phlux_quote.key_point: Chacruna has most of its spice in n-oxide form
phlux_quote.implication: Sodium carbonate paste method for freebasing - acetone pulls only pull DMT, leaving 90% behind
solutions: Freebase using ammonia then evap (DMT-N-oxide insoluble in acetone)
Convert N-oxide to DMT using zinc in acidic environment, then freebase with sodium carbonate

chacruna_discussion.amor_fati_response: Zinc in acid bath might help. Limteks should pull N-oxides in oil flush since no polar layer to contend with. Salting phase would grab them if present in oil.

first_experiment.method: Veggie oil extraction following Q21 lime tech mixed with Spiceman's Poor Man's Tech
first_experiment.freebasing: Heat from oven (no IPA or acetone re-x)
first_experiment.goal: Test if possible using only lime, vinegar, and oil
first_experiment.result: Tar somewhat resembling hash, high yield (~1%)
first_experiment.additional: Mixed with caapi while heating in oven to freebase

bioassay_reports.friend_1: Just as good as other spice made with naphtha
bioassay_reports.friend_2_female: Mixed results, somewhat scared, thought messing with something too powerful

first_experiment.trip_report: Transported to temple/pyramid structure, Mayan/Incan theme, surrounded by waterfalls coming down walls. Very positive experience.

second_experiment.changes: Freebasing with sodium carb instead of heat, acetone wash on final product
second_experiment.yield: Little less than 1g from 100g - could have pulled more from oil
second_experiment.result: Two different substances - white semi-crystalline sparkly dry gunk AND lighter tan resin ball

sodium_carb_problem.issue: Spiceman's tech calls for 1/3 as much sodium carb as acidic water = huge excess after evaporation
sodium_carb_problem.acetone_wash_issue: Excess sodium carb soaks up acetone, won't release it - more of a PULL than a wash
sodium_carb_problem.yield_loss: Losing yield because sodium carb absorbs and holds acetone until it evaporates

second_experiment.call_to_action: THERE MUST BE A BETTER WAY TO FREEBASE THE FINAL PRODUCT!

process: Added water and sodium carb, spread into paste
Dried, added few drops of water, swirled, poured drops onto glass tray
results: Resin ball turned into dry brown flakes, seemed to gain mass
Poured-off water drops (after drying): white/semi-yellow crystals on TOP of sodium carb/yellow gunk
manual_crystallization_attempt.followup: Acetone washing the flakes yielded a resin ball like others
manual_crystallization_attempt.question: Why did this happen? How can we use it to get crystals from this tek?

logos2012_virgin_delight.product_name: Extra Virgin Delight (from olive oil extraction)

organic_soy_experiment.goal: Compare organic soy vs organic EVOO experience
organic_soy_experiment.olive_oil_result: Nice powder, not oily at all (possibly due to IPA pull of freebase)
organic_soy_experiment.plan: Try just water wash of freebase with organic soy

freebase_water_wash_issue.problem: Fumarates did not stick to dish, mostly washed in water
freebase_water_wash_issue.solution: Evaporated water, will pull with IPA
freebase_water_wash_issue.considering: The slow pure white crystallization method

logos2012_virgin_delight.virgin_experience_reports: Two friends tried it - both virgins to smoking DMT. All had great and visual experiences.

slow_crystallization_method.credit: infundibulum gave heads up on this possibility
process: Into fridge for 3 or so days
After retrieving crystals, freeze and thaw water to retrieve last bits
slow_crystallization_method.documentation: Put up with pics on wiki

vinegar_impurity_issue.problem: Something gumming up product, almost like sugar
vinegar_impurity_issue.suspected_source: Vinegar itself - evaporating straight vinegar left a powder
vinegar_impurity_issue.possible_cause: Unique to particular generic brand of vinegar
vinegar_impurity_issue.solution_attempt: Try evaporating Heinz distilled white vinegar instead

related_issue.reference: Similar to goo factor in mescaline acetate discussion
related_issue.user_ragabr_note: Got goo using glacial acetic acid first time, vinegar recently was much gooier and doesn't evap clean

bufotenine_question.question: Anyone tried veggie extraction of Bufotenine? Would it pull the nasties or not?
bufotenine_question.speculation: Perhaps right oil or combination could do close to same as naphtha and heptane

options_discussed.cons: Huge excess sodium carb, absorbs acetone, yield loss
May only work well with fumarates
No one else accomplished without a hitch besides amor_fati

options_discussed.pros: Produces white crystals, documented on wiki

freebasing_methods_comparison.amor_fati_preference: Leaning toward recommending Ice House's tek or simple drytek

detailed_findings.photo_1_description: Precipitates after evaping vinegar used in salting (diluted ~1:2 with water), after IPA wash to remove residual oil and air-drying. Bone dry.
detailed_findings.photo_2_description: Precipitates scraped up - waxy consistency but doesn't adhere easily, quite flaky, could only be compressed into resin for solid chunk
detailed_findings.photo_3_description: Remnants of vaporization - dry powder with sweet taste as if caramelizing

problems_identified: Powder throws off weight of product
Clogs air passage in smoking device if allowed to accumulate

source_investigation.tested: Heinz distilled white vinegar evaporated straight from store
source_investigation.result: Same impurities present - NOT from extraction, FROM the vinegar itself
source_investigation.conclusion: Impurities are in commercial vinegar, not carried over from oil/limonene

april_2011_vinegar_impurity_analysis.mystery: Can't imagine how impurities make it through distillation since they're not volatile - must be added after the fact

harmalosa_experiment_analysis.issue_1: A few drops of water insufficient for washing
harmalosa_experiment_analysis.issue_2: Mass gain indicates leftover sodium carbonate not washed away
harmalosa_experiment_analysis.warning: Freebase droplets may float around - need to make them stick together and adhere to dish
harmalosa_experiment_analysis.vinegar_problem: Too much freebase may end up in suspension and be washed away

manual_crystallization_clarification.key_statement: The ONLY way to get proper freebase crystals from any tek is with slow crystallization and/or heptane. Manual crystallization will yield waxy, clay-like chunks.

acetone_wash_question.question: Would vinegar impurities make it through acetone wash?
acetone_wash_question.amor_fati_response: Wouldn't think so, but will report when tested

may_2011_vinegar_verdict.conclusion: SWIM about ready to throw in the towel on vinegar as salting reagent
reasons: Haven't been able to get near as decent a product as with fumaric acid
Simple drytek with IPA didn't work for purifying
Far too hygroscopic compared to typical freebase
may_2011_vinegar_verdict.possible_solution: Simple home distillation of vinegar may be the only way to rectify this
may_2011_vinegar_verdict.IPA_filtration_note: Could be that filtration was slightly inadequate, but works well in every other case except this one
may_2011_vinegar_verdict.final_recommendation: Fumaric acid is really cheap - just order it

august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.discovery: Glacial acetic acid works MUCH better than commercial vinegar

process.salting: Water with a bit of glacial acetic acid
process.result: No detectable hint of residual acetic acid, very nice and familiar odor

august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.product_form: Could have solidified with technique, but used as goo
august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.smoking_method: Fashioned cone with stainless steel pipe screen, scooped up goo, loaded into piece screen and all
august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.experience: Some of the BEST visuals yet, one of the most satisfying sessions in a while
august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.validation: q21q21's instincts on acetate approach are definitely correct
august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.key_warning: Beware of vinegar - go for GLACIAL ACETIC ACID if you can get it
august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.final_verdict: This is the QUICKEST way of achieving smoke-able product straight from extraction
august_2011_glacial_acetic_breakthrough.future_plan: Will forgo usual fumaric approach for acetic in coming trials

vinegar_vs_glacial_acetic.commercial_vinegar: NOT RECOMMENDED - contains impurities that caramelize, taste sweet, clog devices
vinegar_vs_glacial_acetic.glacial_acetic_acid: RECOMMENDED - clean product, no residual acetic acid smell, excellent results

oil_recommendations.alternative: Organic extra virgin olive oil ('Extra Virgin Delight')

final_workflow.salting: Glacial acetic acid (preferred) OR fumaric acid

key_learnings: Veggie oil produces PURER product than limonene alone
Limonene/veggie oil mixture gives best handling properties
Commercial vinegar contains unknown impurities - avoid
Glacial acetic acid is the quickest path to smokable product
Wide threshold for error - even shoddy experiments yield smokable product
Lime preferred over lye for oil-based extractions
